Pre-Game Insights: The Indiana Pacers (16-17) are at home in Central Division play against the Milwaukee Bucks (16-14) on Tuesday, December 31, 2024 at 3:00 PM ET.
The Pacers are 1.5-point favorites in the game, the second matchup between the squads this season.
Indiana’s record against the spread is 14-19-0.
Milwaukee has 13 wins in 30 games against the spread this season.
The Pacers are 5-12 as 1.5-point favorites or more.
The Bucks are 4-4 as 1.5-point underdogs or greater.
In 18 games this season, the Pacers and their opponents have scored more than 231.5 total points.
The Bucks have played seven games this season that ended with a combined score over 231.5 points.
Indiana has an average total of 231.8 in its matchups this year, which equals this game’s over/under.
Milwaukee’s games this season have had an average of 225.8 points, 5.7 fewer points than this game’s point total.
The Pacers score the seventh-most points in the league this season, while the Bucks’ offense racks up the 25th-most.
The Bucks have surrendered the fifth-fewest points in NBA play this season, while the Pacers have given up the 27th-fewest.
The Pacers have been favorites in 17 games this season and won eight (47.1%) of those contests.
The Bucks have been victorious in two of the eight contests they have been chosen as underdogs in this season.
This season, Indiana has won eight of its 18 games, or 44.4%, when favored by at least -105 on the moneyline.
This year, Milwaukee has won two of eight games when listed as at least -115 or better on the moneyline.
Sportsbooks have implied with the moneyline set for this matchup that the Pacers have a 51.2% chance to win.
